Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer's decision to award 20 points under the 'Education' criterion was fair and procedurally correct
Evidence_Assessment: Visa officer failed to fully consider specialized training evidence
Decision_Outcome: Applicant awarded 20 points instead of 25 or 22 for education
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate procedural unfairness
Legal_Rule: Decisions of visa officers are reviewed for reasonableness unless procedural fairness is violated, which requires correctness review
Standard_of_Review: Correctness (due to alleged procedural fairness violation)
Procedural_Issue: Violation of procedural fairness in assessment of education credentials
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to properly assess medical degree and specialized training
Outcome_on_Merits: Visa officer's decision found procedurally unfair
Review_Standard: Reasonableness, with correctness applied due to procedural fairness issue
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Procedural fairness violated due to inadequate consideration of evidence
Key_Evidence_Considered: Applicant's medical degree, specialized ophthalmology training
Legal_Framework: Administrative law principles, IRPA, procedural fairness
Applicant_Challenge: Dissatisfaction with scoring of education credentials
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence of education and training
Outcome: Case remanded to another visa officer for revaluation
Remedy_Sought: Quashing of original decision and re-assessment
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Incorrect application of education point assessment
Applicable_Process: Economic class immigration assessment under Federal Skilled Worker Program
Governing_Rule: Principles of procedural fairness in administrative decision-making
